e4: Recommending a policy change could lead to investor disappointment and volatility, undermining trust in ABC's stock. By maintaining the current approach, some investors remain optimistic about analyst-calculated returns.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, truthful, and free from intentional bias or deception. In this context, considerations such as educating investors on the change, implementing effective risk management strategies to mitigate potential market reactions, and ensuring accountability for senior executives who are aware of the policy. Such an approach facilitates well-informed decision-making, promotes trust, and maintains regulatory conformity.
e6: I would have follow-up questions on clarifying what actions will be taken to address concerns regarding retail investors being harmed, and how the management team plans to mitigate this issue once introducing an unbiased reporting policy.
